org.kitodo.production.plugin.opac.pica

Class PicaPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kitodo.production.plugin.opac.pica.PicaPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin

    public class PicaPlugin
extends Object
implements net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin
    The class PicaPlugin is the main class of the Goobi PICA catalogue plugin implementation. It provides the public methods void configure(Map) [*] Object find(String, long) String getDescription() [*] Map getHit(Object, long, long) long getNumberOfHits(Object, long) String getTitle() [*] void setPreferences(Prefs) boolean supportsCatalogue(String) void useCatalogue(String) as specified by org.goobi.production.plugin.UnspecificPlugin [*] and org.goobi.production.plugin.CataloguePlugin.CataloguePlugin. Parts of the code of this class have been ported from ancient class org.goobi.production.plugin.opac.PicaOpacImport.
    Author:
    Partly based on previous works of other authors who didn’t leave their names, Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

    • Constructor Detail

      • PicaPlugin

        public PicaPlugin()

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(Map<String,String> configuration)
        The method configure() accepts a Map with configuration parameters. Two entries, "configDir" and "tempDir", are expected. configDir must point to a directory on the local file system where the plug-in can read individual configuration files from. The configuration file, "kitodo_opac.xml" is expected in that directory.
        Parameters:
        configuration - a Map with configuration parameters
        See Also:
        UnspecificPlugin.configure(Map)

      • find

        public Object find(String query,
                   long timeout)
        The function find() initially queries the library catalogue with the given query. If successful, it returns a FindResult with the number of hits.
        Parameters:
        query - a query String. See QueryBuilder for the semantics of the query.
        timeout - timeout in milliseconds after which the operation shall return
        Returns:
        a FindResult that may be used for future operations on the query
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.find(String, long)

      • getDescription

        public static String getDescription(Locale language)
        The function getDescription() returns a human-readable description of the plug-in’s functionality in English. The parameter language is ignored.
        Parameters:
        language - desired language of the human-readable description (support is optional)
        Returns:
        a human-readable description of the plug-in’s functionality
        See Also:
        UnspecificPlugin.getDescription(Locale)

      • getHit

        public Map<String,Object> getHit(Object searchResult,
                                 long index,
                                 long timeout)
        The function getHit() returns the hit with the given index from the given search result as a Map<String, Object>. The map contains the full hit as "fileformat", the docType as "type" and some bibliographic metadata for Production to be able to show a short hit display as supposed in Hit.
        Parameters:
        searchResult - a FindResult created by find(String, long)
        index - the zero-based index of the hit
        timeout - a timeout in milliseconds after which the operation shall return
        Returns:
        a Map with the hit
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.getHit(Object, long, long)

      • getNumberOfHits

        public static long getNumberOfHits(Object searchResult,
                                   long timeout)
        The function getNumberOfHits() returns the number of hits from a given search result.
        Parameters:
        searchResult - the reference to the search whose number of hits shall be looked up
        timeout - ignored because there is no network acceess in this step
        Returns:
        the number of hits
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.getNumberOfHits(Object, long)

      • getTitle

        public static String getTitle(Locale language)
        The function getDescription() returns a human-readable name for the plug-in in English. The parameter language is ignored.
        Parameters:
        language - desired language of the human-readable name (support is optional)
        Returns:
        a human-readable name for the plug-in
        See Also:
        UnspecificPlugin.getTitle(Locale)

      • setPreferences

        public void setPreferences(ugh.dl.Prefs preferences)
        The function setPreferences is called by Production to set the UGH preferences to be used.
        Parameters:
        preferences - the UGH preferences
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.setPreferences(Prefs)

      • supportsCatalogue

        public static boolean supportsCatalogue(String catalogue)
        The function supportsCatalogue() investigates whether the plug-in is able to access a catalogue identified by the given String. (This depends on the configuration.)
        Parameters:
        catalogue - a String indentifying the catalogue
        Returns:
        whether the plug-in is able to acceess that catalogue
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.supportsCatalogue(String)

      • useCatalogue

        public void useCatalogue(String catalogueID)
                  throws ParserConfigurationException
        The function useCatalogue() sets a catalogue to be used
        Parameters:
        catalogueID - a String indentifying the catalogue
        Throws:
        ParserConfigurationException - if a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested
        See Also:
        CataloguePlugin.useCatalogue(String)
